title: How the economy could have looked if Remain won the referendum
text:
It’s October 17, 2019 - but not as you know it. The Leave campaign lost the EU referendum (52-48, of course) and prime minister David Cameron has called a snap election as he attempts to heal the lingering divisions in his party and the country.

Plastered on the side of his big red battle bus is the sum £525m. The UK economy would have lost more than half a billion in output every week from the indecision and deadlock that would have gripped Parliament if the Brexiteers had been victorious, he would claim.

No, you’re not in an Andrew Adonis daydream but an alternate reality - one that could have emerged in a counterfactual history calculated by economists at UBS.

The bank's analysis is not an...
description: It’s October 17, 2019 - but not as you know it.
